trans-unit.source: The abstract base class that represents a binding terminal that supports the flow of data into and out of an activity.
Gets the data type for the data bound to this <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
The data type for the data bound to this <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
Initializes and returns a new <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
The data type of the <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the direction of the flow of data through the <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
The newly created argument.
Creates a new argument that references the specified target argument using the specified referenced argument name.
The target argument to reference.
The name of the referenced argument.
A new argument that references the specified target argument.

Gets an <xref href="System.Activities.ArgumentDirection"></xref> that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref> represents the flow of data into an activity, out of an activity, or both into and out of an activity.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the direction of the flow of data through the <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
Gets or sets a zero-based value that specifies the order in which the argument is evaluated.
By default, the evaluation order of the argument is unspecified and is equal to the <xref:System.Activities.Argument.UnspecifiedEvaluationOrder> value.
Set <xref:System.Activities.Argument.EvaluationOrder%2A> to a value greater or equal to zero to specify an evaluation order for this argument.
[!INCLUDE[wf2](~/includes/wf2-md.md)] evaluates arguments with a specified evaluation order in ascending order.
Note that arguments with an unspecified evaluation order are evaluated before those with a specified evaluation order.
A zero-based value that specifies the order in which the argument is evaluated.
The value is less than zero and not equal to <xref href="System.Activities.Argument.UnspecifiedEvaluationOrder"></xref>.
Gets or sets an <xref href="System.Activities.ActivityWithResult"></xref> that represents the value of the data bound to this <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
The value of the data bound to this <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
Gets the value of the argument using the specified activity context.
The current activity context.
The value of the argument.
Gets the value of the argument using the specified type and activity context.
The current activity context.
The type of the argument.
The value of the argument.
Gets the <xref href="System.Activities.Location"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.
The activity context of the executing activity.
The location for this <xref href="System.Activities.Argument"></xref>.

Represents the constant value of "Result", which corresponds to the name of the <xref href="System.Activities.ActivityWithResult.Result"></xref> property of type <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument"></xref> in the expression base class <xref href="System.Activities.ActivityWithResult"></xref>.
Use this constant to reference the result of an expression activity when using late binding.
Sets the value of the argument using the specified activity context.
The current activity context.
The value for the argument.
Represents the value of the <xref href="System.Activities.Argument.EvaluationOrder"></xref> property for an argument with an unspecified evaluation order.
This value is read-only.
